title: How to Write in Telugu on Any Device

steps.title: Open Google Translate and type your message in the far-left text box.
steps.content: Open Google Translate and type your message in the far-left text box. You can select your preferred language (like “Spanish”) at the top of the box, but the default option, “Detect language,” will determine what language you’re typing in. As you type, Google will translate your message in the right text box. [1] X Research source Optionally, install the Google Input Tools extension on Chrome or the app on Google Play . This creates a virtual keyboard you can use to type in Telugu. [2] X Research source It also has a transliteration feature that converts the written sound of language into text. For example, typing “Namaste” in Hindi turns into “नमस्ते.” [3] X Research source Another free translator is Easy Hindi Typing . Select your language by clicking one of the options above the text boxes.

steps.title: Choose “Telugu” above the right box and copy the translated text.
steps.content: Choose “Telugu” above the right box and copy the translated text. Click the triangle above the text box on the right, then select “Telugu” from the drop-down menu. Click the “Copy” icon, which resembles two overlapping rectangles, at the bottom of the right text box. [4] X Research source Then you can press Ctrl + V (Windows) or ⌘ Command + V (Mac) to paste the translated text into whatever app or web page you’d like to type Telugu in.

steps.title: Open your Settings and go to General management or System.
steps.content: Open your Settings and go to General management or System . Swipe down from the top of your Android's screen and tap the "Settings" icon on the top right. Scroll down and select “General Management” near the bottom of the menu. [5] X Research source You can also go to the Settings app by swiping up from the bottom of your screen and swiping to the right until you see the "Settings" icon. To change your keyboard on WhatsApp to Telugu, follow these steps.

steps.title: Tap the option above Keyboard list and default.
steps.content: Tap the option above Keyboard list and default . Depending on what kind of phone you have and what your default keyboard is, this button might say “Samsung Keyboard settings” or “Gboard settings.” Tap it to enter your keyboard’s settings. [6] X Research source If you don’t see this option, go to “Languages & input” > “Virtual keyboard” or “On-Screen keyboard” > “Gboard.” [7] X Research source

steps.title: Select Languages or Languages and types.
steps.content: Select Languages or Languages and types . If your default keyboard is Samsung, select “Languages and types” at the top of the screen. If you use Gboard, click on “Languages” at the top. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Add keyboard or Manage input languages and select “Telugu.”
steps.content: Tap Add keyboard or Manage input languages and select “Telugu.” For the Samsung keyboard, scroll down or click the magnifying glass in the corner and enter “Telugu” in the search bar. Tap the toggle for “Telugu” or “Telugu (English).” For Gboard, enter “Telugu” in the search bar, select the language you’d like, and press “Done” at the bottom. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Touch and hold the spacebar or swipe left to right to type in Telugu.
steps.content: Touch and hold the spacebar or swipe left to right to type in Telugu. When typing a message on a Samsung phone, switch between the default language and Telugu by swiping the space key from left to right. [10] X Research source On other Android phones, touch and hold the space key to choose what language you’d like to type in. [11] X Research source If neither method works, press the comma key to open the keyboard’s settings and choose “Telugu” from the options.

steps.title: Open your Settings and tap “General”.
steps.content: Open your Settings and tap “General”. The Settings icon is available on your front page and looks like a set of gears on a gray box. “General” is near the top of the Settings page. [12] X Research source These steps also work if you’re looking to change your keyboard on WhatsApp to Telugu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Keyboard, then tap Keyboards.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Keyboard , then tap Keyboards . From here, you can add a keyboard, remove a keyboard, and reorder the keyboard languages in your list. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Add New Keyboard and select Telugu from the list.
steps.content: Tap Add New Keyboard and select Telugu from the list. If you have several keyboards saved, you may have to scroll down to find the “Add New Keyboard” option. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Make Telugu your preferred keyboard language if you’d like to.
steps.content: Make Telugu your preferred keyboard language if you’d like to. Tap “Edit” in the top-right corner of the screen, then tap and drag the far-right side of the “Telugu” entry up to the top of the keyboard list. This makes Telugu your preferred keyboard language. [15] X Research source If you’d like apps and websites on your device to display text in Telugu, go to “Settings” > “General” > “Language & Region” and tap and drag “Telugu” to the top of the list.

steps.title: Tap and hold the emoji or the icon to switch to the Telugu keyboard.
steps.content: Tap and hold the emoji or the icon to switch to the Telugu keyboard. If Telugu is your preferred keyboard language, you may be able to type in Telugu as soon as your keyboard opens up. If not, touch and hold either of these buttons and select “Telugu” or “తెలుగు.” [16] X Research source Now that the Telugu keyboard is selected, you can use it like any other keyboard.

steps.title: Open Start and go to Settings .
steps.content: Open Start and go to Settings . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen or tap the Windows logo key on your keyboard. Click the gear-shaped icon on the top right of the “Start” menu. [17] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source This will also add this keyboard language to Microsoft Word.

steps.title: Click Time & Language and select Language & Region.
steps.content: Click Time & Language and select Language & Region . “Time & Language” is a tab on the left side of the window. Once you’ve clicked that, “Language & Region” is the second option. [18] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select Add a language, type in “Telugu,” and select it from the list.
steps.content: Select Add a language , type in “Telugu,” and select it from the list. “Add a language” is a button located to the right of “Preferred languages.” Once you select “Telugu,” press “Next” to search for those language features. Make sure that the “Language pack” box is checked and hit “Install.” [19] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Check the box next to “Set as my Windows display language” to make features like your Settings and File Explorer appear in Telugu.

steps.title: Click the language icon in the bottom right to switch to Telugu.
steps.content: Click the language icon in the bottom right to switch to Telugu. Once the Telugu keyboard is installed, click the abbreviation for your current keyboard's language (like “ENG” or “SPA”) in the bottom-right corner of the screen next to the time. Select “Telugu” in the pop-up menu. Now you can use your keyboard as usual to type in Telugu characters. [20] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To add Telugu to Microsoft Word, you’ll need to follow the steps above to enable the Telugu keyboard layout on your operating system. After you’ve done that, follow these steps: Open a document in Microsoft Word. Click the Language icon (like “ENG” or “SPA”) on the Language Bar and click “Telugu.” [21] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To include Telugu text in grammar and spelling checks, go to “File” > “Options” > “Language” and select “Telugu” under “Office authoring languages and proofing.” [22] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If Telugu isn’t listed, select “Add a language” and follow the instructions. If the status next to Telugu says “Proofing available,” click the link to install the proofing tools.

steps.title: Open the Apple menu and click System Settings.
steps.content: Open the Apple menu and click System Settings . Click the Apple logo in the top-left corner of the screen and choose “System Settings from the drop-down menu to open up your Settings window. [23] X Research source

steps.title: Click Keyboard in the sidebar.
steps.content: Click Keyboard in the sidebar. You may need to scroll down to find the keyboard-shaped icon. This will take you to your keyboard settings. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Go to Text Input, click “Edit,” then select ＋.
steps.content: Go to Text Input , click “Edit,” then select ＋ . “Text Input” is located on the right side of the window. After you click the ＋ , or “Add” button, you can search for “Telugu.” [25] X Research source Make sure that “Show Input menu in menu bar” is turned on under “Text Input” > “Edit.” This will allow you to quickly switch languages. [26] X Research source

steps.title: Enter “Telugu” in the search bar and select it from the results.
steps.content: Enter “Telugu” in the search bar and select it from the results. Click “Add” next to “Telugu” to add it to your Mac’s input sources. You can also select other languages and add them to your input sources. [27] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Input menu on the menu bar to switch to Telugu.
steps.content: Click the Input menu on the menu bar to switch to Telugu. The Input menu is located on the right side and looks like an icon with letters representing your current language (like “ENG” or “SPA”). [28] X Research source Click this icon, then choose “Telugu” to begin typing in this language. [29] X Research source Press “Control” and spacebar at the same time to quickly select the last language you used. Press the “Control,” “Option,” and spacebar keys to select the next language in the Input menu.
